intro: Saussurea porcii, commonly known as the porcine saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a tall, slender stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flower heads consist of both ray and disk flowers, producing yellowish to brownish blooms. Saussurea porcii is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas.
